title: Worked Solution
text:
Based on the visual information provided in the images, it appears you're working with an emission line spectrum and energy-level diagrams.
For emission spectra:
-The black background with colored lines represents different energy emissions from transitions between energy levels in atoms.
-In the context of energy-level diagrams, each line corresponds to a photon of a specific energy being emitted, with shorter wavelength (higher frequency) lines indicating higher energy transitions.
The second image displays possible energy-level diagrams. The correct answer is noted as  $$	extbf{option b)}$$. Hereâ€™s why:
The first image (emission spectrum) shows four distinct energy transitions (three blue lines and one red line).
-Option b) in the second image shows four possible transitions between energy levels, which corresponds to the number of lines in the emission spectrum.
-The lines' spacing on the energy-level diagram reflects the energy differences between levels, matching the pattern of lines in the spectrum.
If you have more detailed questions on the energy levels or how to interpret the spectrum, feel free to ask!
